thread.title: 30,000 more jobs face the axe at Hewlett-Packard
thread.title_full: 30,000 more jobs face the axe at Hewlett-Packard

title: 30,000 more jobs face the axe at Hewlett-Packard
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now 30,000 more jobs face the axe at Hewlett-Packard The 30,000 job cuts at Hewlett-Packard come on top of 55,000 that were previously announced Paul Sakuma/AP 1 of 1 The 30,000 job cuts at Hewlett-Packard come on top of 55,000 that were previously announced Paul Sakuma/AP Alexandra Frean US Business Editor Published 45 minutes ago 
Hewlett-Packard said it expects to axe up to 30,000 more jobs as it restructures itself into two separate companies and aims for annual cost cuts of $2.7 billion. 
The job losses, which come on top of 55,000 previously announced cuts, will be concentrated in the company’s Hewlett Packard Enterprise unit, which includes servers, storage and networking and which is being spun off in November from its slower growing printers and personal computers business, which will be known as HP Inc. 
“Hewlett Packard Enterprise will be smaller and more focused than HP is today, and we will have a broad and Subscribe now
